bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign of a sensation of a sweet taste on the surface of the tongue despite the fact that one has not ingested any beverage or food. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi yao 百病主 治藥：舌甘：生地黃、芍藥、黃連 , “For sweet taste of the tongue : sheng di huang , shao yao , huang lian ”. LSZ: 舌苦是膽熱，甘是脾熱，酸是濕熱，澀是 風熱，辛是燥熱，咸是脾濕，淡是胃虛 , “A bitter taste of the tongue results from gallbladder heat; a sweet taste [ of the tongue ] results from spleen heat; a sour taste results from moisture heat; a roughness results from wind heat; an acrid taste results from dryness heat; a salty taste results from spleen moisture; a tasteless [tongue] results from stomach depletion”.
